author: EP
title: Un ataque armado en Nigeria deja al menos trece muertos - El Periódico Extremadura
text: Violencia Un ataque armado en Nigeria deja al menos trece muertos EP Al menos trece personas han [muerto](/tags/muerte/) en un ataque perpetrado por parte de hombres armados en la comunidad Anguwan Mai-Giro, que se encuentra entre las localidades de Rafi y Shiro, en el estado nigeriano de Níger, en el centro del país africano. El ataque, que tuvo lugar el miércoles por la noche, ha sido condenado por el gobernador en funciones de Níger, Yajubu Garba, quien ha descrito los hechos como "satánicos, insensibles y atroces". "Es muy desalentador y perturbador que otros seres humanos lleven a cabo un [acto tan bárbaro y cruel](/tags/violencia/)", reza un comunicado. El gobernador ha reafirmado "la determinación y compromiso inquebrantables" de "controlar la ola de inseguridad en el Estado", mientras que ha alentado a las fuerzas de seguridad a "no desanimarse por los ataques a las comunidades", asegurándoles "todo el apoyo". El noreste de [Nigeria](/tags/nigeria/) es el epicentro de las actividades de Boko Haram y su escisión, Estado Islámico en África Occidental (ISWA), si bien la inseguridad se ha extendido a otras zonas del centro, el norte y el noroeste, haciendo saltar las alarmas sobre la posible expansión de estas redes terroristas y criminales. author: Times of Oman
title: Hamas accepts Egypt and Qatar's ceasefire proposal
text:
Tel Aviv: Amid Israel's urgent evacuation notice to residents of eastern Rafah, Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh has sent word of the group's acceptance of a ceasefire proposal to Qatari and Egyptian mediators, Al Jazeera reported on Monday.
Thousands of people flee eastern Rafah after Israel orders people to evacuate as fears of a full-blown military assault on the city sheltering more than one million displaced people grow.
The details of the ceasefire deal have not been disclosed.
This comes as Israel's military issued an urgent evacuation notice to residents of eastern Rafah, following a warning from the country's defence minister of impending "intense action" in the area, CNN reported.
Avichay Adraee, head of the Arab media division of the IDF Spokesperson's Unit, urged residents to "evacuate immediately" to designated humanitarian areas at the checkpoints for their safety. The call specifically targets individuals residing in the municipality of Al-Shawka and the neighbourhoods of Al-Salam, Al-Jneina, Tiba Zaraa, and Al-Bayouk in the Rafah area.
The announcement comes amidst the ongoing bombardment of Gaza, with significant devastation witnessed since October 7. Many residents of Rafah, already displaced multiple times, now face the prospect of further displacement amid escalating conflict, as reported by CNN.
The conflict in Gaza escalated after the October 7 attack by Hamas, where about 2,500 terrorists breached the border into Israel from the Gaza Strip, leading to casualties and the seizure of hostages.
Israel, has since, characterised its Gaza offensive as targeting Hamas' infrastructure with the goal of eliminating the entire terror group while making efforts to minimize civilian casualties.

author: Marta Pérez
title: Joel Martín se queda a un paso del bronce en taekwondo
text: La delegación española no ha podido cerrar con una nueva medalla la primera jornada de competición de los Juegos Paralímpicos de París 2024 a pesar de que la ha rozado. Joel Martín ha perdido su combate por el bronce en -58 kg, en la clase K44, y de esta manera ha terminado en quinta posición. Martín había avanzado vía repesca hacia ese combate por el bronce, pero no ha tenido opciones ante Xiang Wen Xiao, de China Taipéi, quien le ha derrotado por un claro 16-8 para dejarle sin opción de subir al podio. De esta manera, el taekwondista español no ha visto recompensada con una medalla su lucha de toda la jornada. A sus veinte años, en su debut en unos Juegos, Martín ha ganado en su debut en octavos al nigeriano Jabirou Ide Oumarou por 30-13. Sin embargo, ha perdido después en cuartos contra el turco Ali Can Ozcan por 17-22, un resultado que le ha enviado a la repesca, donde necesitaba ganar dos combates para colgarse el bronce. Martín se ha llevado el primero por un ajustado 8-7 contra el japonés Mitsuya Tanaka y ello le ha dado derecho a disputar el combate por la medalla. Sin embargo, Wen Xiao ha dominado esa lucha en todo momento para ser él quien se colgara la medalla.

author: Mariana Labbate
title: 'Demoralized' Russian Prisoner Paul Whelan Pleads With Biden to Do More to Free Him - The Messenger
text: [Texas Teen Says He Shot 2 Friends in the Head Because He Always Wanted to Kill: Police](/news/texas-teen-says-he-shot-2-friends-in-the-head-because-he-always-wanted-to-kill-police?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=trending_story) ‘Demoralized’ Russian Prisoner Paul Whelan Pleads With Biden to Do More to Free Him 'I feel alone. I feel betrayed,' said increasingly demoralized Marine veteran in a phone call from his prison [Mariana Labbate](/author/mariana-labbate) U.S. Marine veteran Paul Whelan has taken to the phone from the Russian penal colony where he has been held for five years to press President Joe Biden to secure his release. He spoke via phone on CNN Thursday to urge the president to use all resources available to bring him back to the U.S. "President Biden, please use every resource available to secure my release, as you would do if your own son was taken hostage," said Whelan. "I feel alone. I feel left behind," added Whelan, who noted he has watched American basketball star Brittney Griner and former U.S. Marine Trevor Reed freed amid negotiations as he waited. Whelan is being held on espionage charges, which both he and the Biden administration refute. Whelan noted cases like this, "foreigners are often used as pawns in diplomatic conflicts." [Russian Prisoner Paul Whelan Calls on Biden to Do More to Secure Release: ‘I’m Still Here’](/politics/paul-whelan-russia-prisoner-biden?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) [First Video of American Paul Whelan in 3 Years Shows Him in Russian Prison Garb](/news/first-video-of-american-paul-whelan-in-3-years-shows-him-in-russian-prison-garb?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) [American Marine Veteran Paul Whelan Attacked by Fellow Prisoner in Russian Labor Camp](/news/paul-whelan-attacked-prison-camp-russia-wrongfully-detained?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) [Paul Whelan Despairs, Says Biden Has ‘Left Me Behind’ in Russian Prison With No Heat, ‘Black Mold’](/news/paul-whelan-bbc-interview-russian-prison-prisoner-exchange?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) [Imprisoned American Paul Whelan Told Blinken Being Left Out of Russian Prisoner Swap Was Basically a ‘Death Warrant’](/politics/imprisoned-american-paul-whelan-told-blinken-being-left-out-of-russian-prisoner-swap-was-basically-a-death-warrant?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) [Whelan Called CNN From Russian Prison to Urge Release](/politics/whelan-called-cnn-from-russian-prison-to-urge-release?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=related_story) "The time is now to take decisive action, to bring the debacle to a close," Whelan continued. The veteran had already [called on Biden via phone earlier this week ](https://themessenger.com/politics/paul-whelan-russia-prisoner-biden)on Christmas eve. "You promised to bring me home. I’m still here," he told the president. Earlier in December, Whelan also accused the Biden administration of " [serious betrayal,](https://themessenger.com/news/paul-whelan-bbc-interview-russian-prison-prisoner-exchange)" saying it was "unfathomable to me that they've left me behind." Earlier this month, Russian President Vladimir Putin said Moscow has been speaking with U.S. officials about Whelan and imprisoned [Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich](https://themessenger.com/news/russian-court-extends-detention-of-wall-street-journal-reporter-gershkovich-until-end-of-january). Whelan's twin brother, David Whelan, told [National Public Radio](https://www.wbur.org/hereandnow/2023/12/28/paul-whelan-russia-detention) on Thursday that he is increasingly worried about the former Marine, who has grown seriously demoralized this past year, particularly following an attack by a fellow prisoner. He was unsure if Russian authorities have allowed him to use prison phones to call out, or if he may have obtained an "illicit" or "unauthorized" phone to make his urgent new pleas for freedom. author: Estadão Conteúdo
title: Chuva na região serrana do RJ pode ter mesmo volume que causou tragédia em 2011, alerta Cemaden
text:
O Rio de Janeiro deve enfrentar neste fim de semana chuvas intensas com acumulados superiores a 200 milímetros por dia, um patamar semelhante ao que desencadeou a tragédia vista no Estado em 2011, quando cerca de mil pessoas morreram em deslizamentos na região serrana. As previsões foram divulgadas pelo Centro Nacional de Monitoramento e Alertas de Desastres Naturais (Cemaden), que espera grandes volumes de chuva a partir da tarde desta sexta-feira, 22.
A maior intensidade é prevista para a madrugada de sexta-feira para sábado, 23, dia apontado como mais crítico, especialmente, na região serrana do Estado. “Episódios de deslizamentos podem ser generalizados. Não podemos descartar, inclusive, episódios mais graves, levando em conta o volume previsto, com corridas de massa ou corrida de detritos”, afirmou o coordenador de operações do Cemaden, Marcelo Seluchi, em coletiva de imprensa.
Na região metropolitana e no sul do Estado, o volume de chuva deve seguir a mesma média prevista para a região serrana. Ainda que os maiores riscos estejam concentrados na serra, o norte do Estado e a costa oeste também devem registrar chuvas fortes.
As previsões levaram o governador do estado, Cláudio Castro (PL) a decretar ponto facultativo no Rio de Janeiro. “Peço que as pessoas fiquem em casa e não se arrisquem em locais ao ar livre”, disse em comunicado nas redes sociais.
O monitoramento de risco do Cemanden está sendo atualizado e divulgado em tempo real nas redes do governo do Estado durante o fim de semana.
O Cemaden foi fundado em 2011, quando acumulados de chuva eram semelhantes ao previsto para esse fim de semana. Na ocasião, chuvas fortes atingiram 16 cidades do Rio de Janeiro; Teresópolis, Nova Friburgo e Petrópolis foram as mais afetadas. Ao todo, o número de mortos se aproximou de mil, enquanto cerca de 25 mil ficaram desabrigados.
“O que haveria de semelhança em relação a 2011: acumulados de chuvas superiores a 200 milímetros, possivelmente de 300 milímetros. Números também observados em janeiro de 2011?, disse Giovanni Dolif, meteorologista e pesquisador do Cemaden ao canal CNN.
Regina Alvalá, coordenadora do Cemaden, explica que as previsões para desastres são baseadas em uma somatória de fatores que possibilitam a avaliação de riscos. “Olhamos, além das previsões de tempo, para as chuvas que já caíram e o solo absorveu em dias pretéritos, mais a chuva que esteja caindo no momento e mais a previsão do tempo”, afirmou.
A chuva, segundo o Instituto Nacional de Meteorologia (Inmet) é consequência da aproximação de uma frente fria que avançou pela Região Sul do País na quinta-feira. “Ao longo da sexta (22) e do sábado (23), a previsão é de que esse sistema atue pelo leste da Região Sudeste causando grandes volumes, podendo levar transtornos à população”, informou o órgão federal em nota.

author: Ed Easton Jr., John Dillon, Andrew Garcia, Jon Ediger, USA TODAY
title: Predictions for Chiefs' regular season opener vs. Ravens
text: The Kansas City Chiefs will kick off their quest for a three-peat with the opening game of the 2024 regular season, an AFC Championship rematch against the Baltimore Ravens this evening. Every game counts moving forward, as Arrowhead Stadium will be loud and ready to celebrate last year's accomplishment and look forward to more success starting tonight. Though Kansas City will have an edge playing at home, Baltimore added some serious firepower to its offense during the offseason by signing star running back Derrick Henry, who could wreck the Chiefs' gameplan in Week 1. Check out our predictions for Kansas City's matchup against Baltimore: Ed Easton Jr.'s Prediction The Kansas City Chiefs’ regular season is officially underway with the much-anticipated matchup with the Baltimore Ravens. On banner night, a celebratory Arrowhead Stadium crowd will rock for the defending champions. Patrick Mahomes and the offense will look to get off to a fast start by showcasing the team’s new weapons. Isiah Pacheco’s consistency will be essential in the running game, as the Chiefs want to maintain a healthy balance without relying too much on Mahomes or Travis Kelce. The Ravens’ defense is talented, so the offense must avoid turnovers and poor field position. On defense, Chris Jones on the defensive line will play their first game together since Super Bowl LVIII after the All-Pro missed preseason play. The cornerback position will be the group to watch as everyone after Trent McDuffie is a question mark heading into Thursday. Special teams with the new look kickoff are also important, but the Chiefs have a former Pro Bowler in Mecole Hardman and third-year receiver Skyy Moore as viable options. The Chiefs should be solid enough to pull off the victory to start the new season and win the game. Final Score: Chiefs 28, Ravens 17 Jon Ediger's Prediction The 2024 regular season is officially here, as the Baltimore Ravens head to Kansas City to face the Chiefs in a much-anticipated Thursday night matchup. For the Ravens, banner night means revenge, after the Chiefs bested Baltimore in the AFC Championship Game earlier this year en route to their second-straight Super Bowl victory. The loss of wide receiver Marquise 'Hollywood' Brown in tonight's game could prove to be a major factor in the outcome, but given Kansas City's newfound depth at the wide receiver position, it seems likely that the former Sooner's teammates will be able to up the slack. Reigning MVP Lamar Jackson is a force to be reckoned with, and should be expected to have a big game tonight, but defensive coordinator Steve Spagnuolo's defense has trained all offseason for this game and will have an answer. Final Score: Chiefs 34, Ravens 23. Andrew Garcia's prediction Both of these teams got better during the offseason, and perhaps if this game was being played at M&T Bank Stadium in Baltimore the Ravens would have a better chance at getting revenge on Kansas City in this matchup. Given that the Chiefs will be celebrating their Super Bowl LVIII victory in front of a home crowd, it seems unlikely that the defending champions will come out flat against such a high-profile opponent, especially after their Week 1 collapse last season. Baltimore's roster is outstanding, and the Ravens have all the talent they need to pull off an upset to spoil Kansas City's party, but the Chiefs seem like the logical choice tonight. Final Score: Chiefs 13, Ravens 10 John Dillon's prediction The outcome of this matchup will come down to Kansas City's ability to contain Baltimore's new-look ground game that has All-World running back Derrick Henry paired with Lamar Jackson, who is a dynamo in his own right. Though the Chiefs have been able to contain Henry and Jackson individually in the past, this new dynamic in the Ravens' offense could prove to be too much for Kansas City to handle, and lead to disastrous results for the home team if they let Baltimore get out to an early lead. To me, this game is a toss-up, and could truly go either way. For now, though, I'll call it in the Chiefs' favor and predict a 1-0 start to Kansas City's season. Final Score: Chiefs 32, Ravens 28 More Chiefs content Check out everything you need to know to watch the Chiefs' matchup against the Ravens on Thursday night.

author: PublicTechnology staff
title: How digital patient records will transform Northern Irish healthcare – PublicTechnology
text: This year has been one of ‘resilience, reflection and hope, and has been marked by major technological progress, according to the head of the Northern Ireland Civil Service Jayne Brady The yearly [Permanent Secretaries Roundup](https://www.civilserviceworld.com/more/permanent-secretaries-roundup.htm) published by PublicTechnology sister publication [Civil Service World](https://www.civilserviceworld.com/) sees government’s senior leaders discuss the experiences of the past year – as well as shedding light on their plans for festive season. Northern Ireland Civil Service head Jayne Brady discusses a year of major digital progress. Tell us three words that sum up your 2023… Resilience, reflection and hope. …and why you chose those words 2023 has been a year when NI civil servants have again demonstrated incredible professional resilience. We commenced the year with optimism and a focus on rebuilding post-pandemic. The reality was quite different as we entered 2023 against a backdrop of global conflict, cost-of-living issues, stretched public services, the absence of our governing institutions and a very challenging financial position. Despite – or perhaps because of – these tests, we asked even more of our people, who continued to deliver their best for those we serve. This included achieving groundbreaking innovation to improve service delivery. Our shared success ranged from award-winning projects in people and organisational development, to the digitisation of a multi-million-pounds soil nutrient scheme. Our giant leap this year was the beginning of our roll-out of fully digitised patient records. While this project was specific to one health trust, we have plans to scale to all of NI. This is hugely significant for transformation in health and social care. Reflecting on these achievements, it is clear that our people are the true cornerstone of our accomplishments. It was not lost on me as we marked 25 years of peace with the anniversary of the Belfast Good Friday Agreement that it was the determination and expertise of civil servants who turned the wheel of change in 1998 and still do today. In the last 25 years, Northern Ireland has changed unrecognisably and while there is still much to do, our progress is cause for hope; and hope is never more tangible than during the festive season. We will need to hold onto it as we face the challenges to come and continue rebuilding. What are your organisational and personal priorities for 2024? I can’t consider 2024 without reemphasising the importance of my colleagues. It would be wrong of me to ask more of them next year without getting the fundamentals right, including a pay award worthy of their efforts. This means building resilience and people-centredness into our structures in a way that benefits not just civil servants, but our economy, society, environment. What’s your favourite festive treat, and what makes you say: ‘Bah, humbug’? Festive wrapping – especially the plastic kind – makes everyone in my family say ‘bah, humbug’, but my favourite festive tradition is relaxing and resetting with my oldest and dearest friends. We meet annually on the 23rd of December and discuss our hopes for the year ahead. With that in mind, I encourage all my colleagues to take time to re-energise and savour quality time with loved ones. I know that, for some, this can be a difficult time of year, but I trust that all of us will find reasons for hope as we look to 2024. I am reminded of the words of Seamus Heaney: “Hope is not optimism, which expects things to turn out well, but something rooted in the conviction that there is good worth working for.” All entries in Civil Service World’s [2023 Permanent Secretaries Roundup can be read here](https://www.civilserviceworld.com/more/permanent-secretaries-roundup.htm)

author: Cristina González Oliva
title: Agüimes construirá en impresión 3D un centro de formación
text: Secciones Servicios Destacamos Agüimes Jueves, 17 de octubre 2024, 22:54 Necesitas ser registrado para acceder a esta funcionalidad. Opciones para compartir El municipio de Agüimes apuesta por primera vez por la construcción de un edificio a través de la impresión 3D en hormigón y se convierte así en la primera institución pública en Canarias que lo impulsa y posiblemente en España y en Europa, ya que al Ayuntamiento no le consta que se haya hecho hasta ahora desde una administración. Con esta condición, que se ejecute con esta tecnología, ha sacado a licitación el nuevo centro de formación en La Goleta con un presupuesto de casi 500.000 euros. El concejal de Obras Públicas, Rubén Romero, detalla que esta infraestructura es una necesidad en el municipio para cubrir la demanda de espacios formativos y destacó que Agüimes siempre se ha caracterizado por ser pionero en diferentes ámbitos, como las energías renovables, la sostenibilidad o la gestión de los recursos naturales. Y en esta ocasión sigue en esa línea, la de dar cabida a proyectos innovadores desde la administración pública, impulsando la consolidación del polígono industrial de Arinaga como laboratorio de ideas, reduciendo la dependencia tecnológica y facilitando la atracción de capital inversor extranjero. La intención es impulsar este tipo de tecnología puntera ya que existen empresas que pueden llegar a altos niveles de automatización, por lo que en este caso el concurso requiere un grado del 60 por ciento. Con este proyecto pretenden acercar este tipo de novedades a la zona, como ya lo está haciendo Ecoaga con la construcción de un edificio en el Cruce de Arinaga. Romero especifica que este tipo de construcción es más rápida, aunque se ha estipulado un plazo de ejecución amplio, de 16 meses, ya que prevé que las obras puedan ser visitada por grupos de interés. Además, genera menos residuos y optimiza los materiales. Asimismo, el edil hizo hincapié en que este edificio, que destacará por su singularidad ya que será de los primeros en Canarias, cumplirá con las normativas actuales estipuladas en el Código Técnico de Edificación. La infraestructura tendrá dos plantas y se levantará en una parcela de 1.858 metros cuadrados, de la que solo se utilizará el 21 por ciento, ubicada en la intersección de las calles Quevedo con San Juan de la Cruz y Berceo. En la plata baja contará con un aula polivalente de 123,81 metros cuadrados que permite dar respuesta tanto a actividades teóricas como prácticas a grupos reducidos de 15 alumnos o grupos ampliados de 25 alumnos. author: Jerzy Lewandowski
title: Innovative AgTech Firm Deploys Drone Army to Boost Crop Health
text:
Innovative AgTech Firm Deploys Drone Army to Boost Crop Health
In a modern twist to pest management, UAV-IQ Precision Agriculture is redefining the use of technology in farming. Operating from California, this compact enterprise has garnered attention for its unique approach in maintaining crop wellbeing. Rather than relying on conventional pesticides, UAV-IQ utilizes drones as their prime agents, deploying swarms of tens of thousands of natural predators across agricultural lands.
By unleashing beneficial insects and mites from the skies, these drones efficiently combat harmful pests that threaten crops. This method not only embodies advanced technological use in agriculture but also symbolizes a commitment to environmentally friendly farming practices. The innovative strategy showcases how the integration of emerging tech and ecological mindfulness can revolutionize traditional agricultural methods.
UAV-IQ’s foray into aerial pest control reflects a seamless blend of unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) with intelligent solutions, providing farmers with an effective, yet sustainable option to protect their yields. As drones take on a crucial role in agriculture, it’s clear that UAV-IQ is at the forefront of this agricultural evolution, armed with their buzzing fleet ready to safeguard the fruits of labor on the ground.
Summary: UAV-IQ Precision Agriculture, based in California, is at the forefront of integrating technology with eco-friendly farming practices. Their utilization of drones to release beneficial predators over crops signifies a shift towards innovative and sustainable agricultural methodologies, promising a healthier future for farming.
FAQ Section Based on the Article
What is UAV-IQ Precision Agriculture?
UAV-IQ Precision Agriculture is a company based in California that specializes in integrating technology with farming practices to maintain crop health.

Instead of conventional pesticides, UAV-IQ uses drones to deploy natural predators, such as beneficial insects and mites, to control harmful pests in agricultural lands.

Their method minimizes the use of chemical pesticides, opting for natural pest control solutions, which reduces environmental impact and promotes sustainable farming.
What are the benefits of using drones in agriculture?
Drones offer efficient and precise distribution of beneficial predators over wide areas of crops, leading to potentially reduced labor costs and better pest management.
What does the UAV-IQ’s approach signify for farming?
UAV-IQ’s strategy demonstrates a shift toward innovative and sustainable agricultural methods that combine emerging technologies with ecological mindfulness.

– Pest Management: The process of monitoring and controlling pests to prevent them from causing damage to crops.

title: Supreme Court rejects settlement with OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma over legal protections for the Sackler family that owned the company | Political News | ArcaMax Publishing
text:
The Supreme Court ruled 5-4 against an estimated US$6 billion Purdue Pharma bankruptcy plan on June 27, 2024, that would have shielded the Sackler family – which owned and controlled the company – from legal liability.
Hundreds of thousands of Americans have died from opioid-related overdoses since Purdue rolled out OxyContin in 1996. The company helped spur a public health crisis through its deceptive marketing and aggressive sales of OxyContin, a prescription opioid painkiller.
The company, but not the family, sought bankruptcy protection in 2019 in exchange for contributions to a global settlement deal. That settlement would have forever protected the Sacklers – as well as hundreds of affiliates and other Purdue Pharma insiders – from all opioid-related civil claims. Because the Sacklers have said they would reject any deal without legal immunity, this Supreme Court ruling makes the fate of this settlement unclear.
The Conversation asked Temple University law professor Jonathan Lipson to explain what the ruling in this case, Harrington v. Purdue Pharma , means for the company, the Sacklers, people harmed by OxyContin and the public.
In the near term, it means that the effort by Purdue and the Sacklers to limit their liability will go back to the bankruptcy court, where the deal will probably be renegotiated. In the long term, it means that powerful people cannot use their company’s bankruptcy to escape accountability.
This ruling will further delay the roughly $6 billion promised under Purdue’s plan. So far, companies involved in the manufacturing, distribution and sale of opioids have reached settlements that are contributing $50 billion to efforts to abate the opioid crisis.
 The majority was careful to say that its opinion was “narrow” and should not upset similar prior deals. But, going forward, corporate insiders will no longer be able to use their companies’ bankruptcies to force creditors to give up claims. In many ways, this decision simply confirms the status quo: If you have liability for misconduct, you cannot latch onto a company’s bankruptcy to get out of it.
You either have to defend the claims in court or file for bankruptcy yourself.
The technical term for what this very wealthy family sought – and what the court’s majority rejected – is a “ nonconsensual third-party release .”
“Release” is a bit of a misnomer, though, because that is really a contractual concept, and there is nothing contractual about what the Sacklers demanded. They wanted an injunction from a federal bankruptcy court that would forever bar anyone who might try to hold them accountable from suing them for their role at Purdue Pharma when the company committed two sets of confessed drug-marketing crimes .
